   21: %%
   22: -module(mnesia_atomicity_test).
   23: -author('hakan@erix.ericsson.se').
   24: -author('rossi@erix.ericsson.se').
   25: -include("mnesia_test_lib.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   28:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   29:          all/0, groups/0]).
   30: -export([explicit_abort_in_middle_of_trans/1,
   31:          runtime_error_in_middle_of_trans/1,
   32:          mnesia_down_during_infinite_trans/1,
   33:          kill_self_in_middle_of_trans/1, throw_in_middle_of_trans/1,
   34:          lock_waiter_sw_r/1, lock_waiter_sw_rt/1, lock_waiter_sw_wt/1,
   35:          lock_waiter_wr_r/1, lock_waiter_srw_r/1, lock_waiter_sw_sw/1,
   36:          lock_waiter_sw_w/1, lock_waiter_sw_wr/1, lock_waiter_sw_srw/1,
   37:          lock_waiter_wr_wt/1, lock_waiter_srw_wt/1,
   38:          lock_waiter_wr_sw/1, lock_waiter_srw_sw/1, lock_waiter_wr_w/1,
   39:          lock_waiter_srw_w/1, lock_waiter_r_sw/1, lock_waiter_r_w/1,
   40:          lock_waiter_r_wt/1, lock_waiter_rt_sw/1, lock_waiter_rt_w/1,
   41:          lock_waiter_rt_wt/1, lock_waiter_wr_wr/1,
   42:          lock_waiter_srw_srw/1, lock_waiter_wt_r/1, lock_waiter_wt_w/1,
   43:          lock_waiter_wt_rt/1, lock_waiter_wt_wt/1, lock_waiter_wt_wr/1,
   44:          lock_waiter_wt_srw/1, lock_waiter_wt_sw/1, lock_waiter_w_wr/1,
   45:          lock_waiter_w_srw/1, lock_waiter_w_sw/1, lock_waiter_w_r/1,
   46:          lock_waiter_w_w/1, lock_waiter_w_rt/1, lock_waiter_w_wt/1,
   47:          restart_r_one/1, restart_w_one/1, restart_rt_one/1,
   48:          restart_wt_one/1, restart_wr_one/1, restart_sw_one/1,
   49:          restart_r_two/1, restart_w_two/1, restart_rt_two/1,
   50:          restart_wt_two/1, restart_wr_two/1, restart_sw_two/1
   51:         ]
   52:        ).
   53: 
   54: -export([perform_restarted_transaction/1, sync_tid_release/0]).
   55: 
   56: init_per_testcase(Func, Conf) ->
   57:     mnesia_test_lib:init_per_testcase(Func, Conf).
   58: 
   59: end_per_testcase(Func, Conf) ->
   60:     mnesia_test_lib:end_per_testcase(Func, Conf).
   61: 
   62: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
   63: all() ->
   64:     [explicit_abort_in_middle_of_trans,
   65:      runtime_error_in_middle_of_trans,
   66:      kill_self_in_middle_of_trans, throw_in_middle_of_trans,
   67:      {group, mnesia_down_in_middle_of_trans}].
   68: 
   69: groups() ->
   70:     [{mnesia_down_in_middle_of_trans, [],
   71:       [mnesia_down_during_infinite_trans,
   72:        {group, lock_waiter}, {group, restart_check}]},
   73:      {lock_waiter, [],
   74:       [lock_waiter_sw_r, lock_waiter_sw_rt, lock_waiter_sw_wt,
   75:        lock_waiter_wr_r, lock_waiter_srw_r, lock_waiter_sw_sw,
   76:        lock_waiter_sw_w, lock_waiter_sw_wr, lock_waiter_sw_srw,
   77:        lock_waiter_wr_wt, lock_waiter_srw_wt,
   78:        lock_waiter_wr_sw, lock_waiter_srw_sw, lock_waiter_wr_w,
   79:        lock_waiter_srw_w, lock_waiter_r_sw, lock_waiter_r_w,
   80:        lock_waiter_r_wt, lock_waiter_rt_sw, lock_waiter_rt_w,
   81:        lock_waiter_rt_wt, lock_waiter_wr_wr,
   82:        lock_waiter_srw_srw, lock_waiter_wt_r, lock_waiter_wt_w,
   83:        lock_waiter_wt_rt, lock_waiter_wt_wt, lock_waiter_wt_wr,
   84:        lock_waiter_wt_srw, lock_waiter_wt_sw, lock_waiter_w_wr,
   85:        lock_waiter_w_srw, lock_waiter_w_sw, lock_waiter_w_r,
   86:        lock_waiter_w_w, lock_waiter_w_rt, lock_waiter_w_wt]},
   87:      {restart_check, [],
   88:       [restart_r_one, restart_w_one, restart_rt_one,
   89:        restart_wt_one, restart_wr_one, restart_sw_one,
   90:        restart_r_two, restart_w_two, restart_rt_two,
   91:        restart_wt_two, restart_wr_two, restart_sw_two]}].
   92: 
   93: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   94:     Config.
   95: 
   96: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   97:     Config.
   98: 
   99: 
  100: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  101: explicit_abort_in_middle_of_trans(suite) -> [];
  102: explicit_abort_in_middle_of_trans(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  103:     [Node1] = Nodes = ?acquire_nodes(1, Config),
  104:     Tab = explicit_abort_in_middle_of_trans,
  105: 
  106:     Rec1A = {Tab, 1, a},
  107:     Rec1B = {Tab, 1, b},
  108: 
  109:     ?match({atomic, ok}, mnesia:create_table([{name, Tab},
  110: 					     {ram_copies, [Node1]}])),
  111:     %% Start a transaction on one node
  112:     {success, [A]} = ?start_activities([Node1]),
  113: 
  114:     %% store an object in the Tab - first transaction
  115:     ?start_transactions([A]),
  116:     A ! fun() ->
  117: 		mnesia:write(Rec1A)	% returns ok when successful
  118: 	 end,
  119:     ?match_receive({A, ok}),
  120:     A ! end_trans,
  121:     ?match_receive({A, {atomic, end_trans}}),
  122: 
  123:     %% second transaction: store some new objects and abort before the
  124:     %% transaction is finished -> the new changes should be invisable
  125:     ?start_transactions([A]),
  126:     A ! fun() ->
  127: 		mnesia:write(Rec1B),
  128: 		exit(abort_by_purpose) %does that stop the process A ???
  129: 	 end,
  130:     ?match_receive({A, {aborted, abort_by_purpose}}),
  131: 
  132: 
  133:     %?match_receive({A, {'EXIT', Pid, normal}}), % A died and sends EXIT
  134: 
  135: 
  136:     %% Start a second  transactionprocess, after the first failed
  137:     {success, [B]} = ?start_activities([Node1]),
  138: 
  139:     %% check, whether the interrupted transaction had no influence on the db
  140:     ?start_transactions([B]),
  141:     B ! fun() ->
  142: 		?match([Rec1A], mnesia:read({Tab, 1})),
  143: 		ok
  144: 	 end,
  145:     ?match_receive({B, ok}),
  146:     B ! end_trans,
  147:     ?match_receive({B, {atomic, end_trans}}),
  148: 
  149:     ?verify_mnesia(Nodes, []).
  150: 
  151: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  152: runtime_error_in_middle_of_trans(suite) -> [];
  153: runtime_error_in_middle_of_trans(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  154:     [Node1] = Nodes = ?acquire_nodes(1, Config),
  155:     Tab = runtime_error_in_middle_of_trans,
  156: 
  157:     Rec1A = {Tab, 1, a},
  158:     Rec1B = {Tab, 1, b},
  159:     Rec1C = {Tab, 1, c},
  160: 
  161:     ?match({atomic, ok}, mnesia:create_table([{name, Tab},
  162: 					     {ram_copies, [Node1]}])),
  163:     %% Start a transaction on one node
  164:     {success, [A]} = ?start_activities([Node1]),
  165: 
  166:     %% store an object in the Tab - first transaction
  167:     ?start_transactions([A]),
  168:     A ! fun() ->
  169: 		mnesia:write(Rec1A)	% returns ok when successful
  170: 	 end,
  171:     ?match_receive({A, ok}),
  172:     A ! end_trans,
  173:     ?match_receive({A, {atomic, end_trans}}),
  174: 
  175:     %% second transaction: store some new objects and abort before the
  176:     %% transaction is finished -> the new changes should be invisable
  177:     ?start_transactions([A]),
  178:     A ! fun() ->
  179: 		mnesia:write(Rec1B),
  180:                 erlang:error(foo), % that should provoke a runtime error
  181: 		mnesia:write(Rec1C)
  182: 	 end,
  183:     ?match_receive({A, {aborted, _Reason}}),
  184: 
  185:     %?match_receive({A, {'EXIT', Msg1}), % A died and sends EXIT
  186: 
  187: 
  188:     %% Start a second  transactionprocess, after the first failed
  189:     {success, [B]} = ?start_activities([Node1]),
  190: 
  191:     %% check, whether the interrupted transaction had no influence on the db
  192:     ?start_transactions([B]),
  193:     B ! fun() ->
  194: 		?match([Rec1A], mnesia:read({Tab, 1})),
  195: 		ok
  196: 	 end,
  197:     ?match_receive({B, ok}),
  198:     B ! end_trans,
  199:     ?match_receive({B, {atomic, end_trans}}),
  200: 
  201:     ?verify_mnesia(Nodes, []).
  202: 
  203: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  204: kill_self_in_middle_of_trans(suite) -> [];
  205: kill_self_in_middle_of_trans(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  206:     [Node1] = Nodes = ?acquire_nodes(1, Config),
  207:     Tab = kill_self_in_middle_of_trans,
  208: 
  209:     Rec1A = {Tab, 1, a},
  210:     Rec1B = {Tab, 1, b},
  211:     Rec1C = {Tab, 1, c},
  212: 
  213:     ?match({atomic, ok}, mnesia:create_table([{name, Tab},
  214: 					     {ram_copies, [Node1]}])),
  215:     %% Start a transaction on one node
  216:     {success, [A]} = ?start_activities([Node1]),
  217: 
  218:     %% store an object in the Tab - first transaction
  219:     ?start_transactions([A]),
  220:     A ! fun() ->
  221: 		mnesia:write(Rec1A)	% returns ok when successful
  222: 	 end,
  223:     ?match_receive({A, ok}),
  224:     A ! end_trans,
  225:     ?match_receive({A, {atomic, end_trans}}),
  226: 
  227:     %% second transaction: store some new objects and abort before the
  228:     %% transaction is finished -> the new changes should be invisable
  229:     ?start_transactions([A]),
  230:     A ! fun() ->
  231: 		mnesia:write(Rec1B),
  232:                 exit(self(), kill), % that should kill the process himself
  233: 		                        %   - poor guy !
  234: 		mnesia:write(Rec1C)
  235: 	 end,
  236:     %%
  237:     %% exit(.., kill) : the transaction can't trap this error - thus no
  238:     %%                 proper result can be send by the test server
  239: 
  240:     % ?match_receive({A, {aborted, Reason}}),
  241: 
  242:     ?match_receive({'EXIT', _Pid, killed}), % A is killed and sends EXIT
  243: 
  244:     %% Start a second  transactionprocess, after the first failed
  245:     {success, [B]} = ?start_activities([Node1]),
  246: 
  247:     %% check, whether the interrupted transaction had no influence on the db
  248:     ?start_transactions([B]),
  249:     B ! fun() ->
  250: 		?match([Rec1A], mnesia:read({Tab, 1})),
  251: 		ok
  252: 	 end,
  253:     ?match_receive({B, ok}),
  254:     B ! end_trans,
  255:     ?match_receive({B, {atomic, end_trans}}),
  256: 
  257:     ?verify_mnesia(Nodes, []).
  258: 
  259: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  260: throw_in_middle_of_trans(suite) -> [];
  261: throw_in_middle_of_trans(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  262:     [Node1] = Nodes = ?acquire_nodes(1, Config),
  263:     Tab = throw_in_middle_of_trans,
  264: 
  265:     Rec1A = {Tab, 1, a},
  266:     Rec1B = {Tab, 1, b},
  267:     Rec1C = {Tab, 1, c},
  268: 
  269:     ?match({atomic, ok}, mnesia:create_table([{name, Tab},
  270: 					     {ram_copies, [Node1]}])),
  271:     %% Start a transaction on one node
  272:     {success, [A]} = ?start_activities([Node1]),
  273: 
  274:     %% store an object in the Tab - first transaction
  275:     ?start_transactions([A]),
  276:     A ! fun() ->
  277: 		mnesia:write(Rec1A)	% returns ok when successful
  278: 	 end,
  279:     ?match_receive({A, ok}),
  280:     A ! end_trans,
  281:     ?match_receive({A, {atomic, end_trans}}),
  282: 
  283:     %% second transaction: store some new objects and abort before the
  284:     %% transaction is finished -> the new changes should be invisable
  285:     ?start_transactions([A]),
  286:     A ! fun() ->
  287: 		mnesia:write(Rec1B),
  288:                 throw(exit_transactian_by_a_throw),
  289: 		mnesia:write(Rec1C)
  290: 	 end,
  291:     ?match_receive({A, {aborted, {throw, exit_transactian_by_a_throw}}}),
  292:     % A ! end_trans, % is A still alive ?
  293:     % ?match_receive({A, {atomic, end_trans}}), % {'EXIT', Pid, normal}
  294: 
  295:     %?match_receive({A, {'EXIT', Pid, normal}}), % A died and sends EXIT
  296: 
  297:     %% Start a second  transactionprocess, after the first failed
  298:     {success, [B]} = ?start_activities([Node1]),
  299: 
  300:     %% check, whether the interrupted transaction had no influence on the db
  301:     ?start_transactions([B]),
  302:     B ! fun() ->
  303: 		?match([Rec1A], mnesia:read({Tab, 1})),
  304: 		ok
  305: 	 end,
  306:     ?match_receive({B, ok}),
  307:     B ! end_trans,
  308:     ?match_receive({B, {atomic, end_trans}}),
  309: 
  310:     ?verify_mnesia(Nodes, []).
  311: 
  312: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  313: 
  314: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  315: mnesia_down_during_infinite_trans(suite) -> [];
  316: mnesia_down_during_infinite_trans(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  317:     [Node1, Node2]  = ?acquire_nodes(2, Config),
  318:     Tab = mnesia_down_during_infinite_trans,
  319: 
  320:     ?match({atomic, ok},
  321: 	   mnesia:create_table([{name, Tab}, {ram_copies, [Node1, Node2]}])),
  322:     %% Start a transaction on one node
  323:     {success, [A2, A1]} = ?start_activities([Node2, Node1]),
  324:     %% Start order of the transactions are important
  325:     %% We also needs to sync the tid counter
  326:     ?match({atomic, ok},
  327: 	   mnesia:transaction(fun() -> mnesia:write({Tab, 1, test_ok}) end)),
  328:     mnesia_test_lib:start_sync_transactions([A2, A1]),
  329: 
  330:     %% Obtain a write lock and wait forever
  331:     RecA = {Tab, 1, test_not_ok},
  332:     A1 ! fun() -> mnesia:write(RecA) end,
  333:     ?match_receive({A1, ok}),
  334: 
  335:     A1 ! fun() -> process_flag(trap_exit, true), timer:sleep(infinity) end,
  336:     ?match_receive(timeout),
  337: 
  338:     %% Try to get read lock, but gets queued
  339:     A2 ! fun() -> mnesia:read({Tab, 1}) end,
  340:     ?match_receive(timeout),
  341: 
  342:     %% Kill Mnesia on other node
  343:     mnesia_test_lib:kill_mnesia([Node1]),
  344: 
  345:     %% Second transaction gets the read lock
  346:     ?match_receive({A2, [{Tab, 1, test_ok}]}),
  347:     exit(A1, kill), % Needed since we trap exit
  348: 
  349:     ?verify_mnesia([Node2], [Node1]).
  350: 
  351: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  352: 
  353: lock_waiter_sw_r(suite) -> [];
  354: lock_waiter_sw_r(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  355:     start_lock_waiter(sw, r, Config).
  356: 
  357: lock_waiter_sw_rt(suite) -> [];
  358: lock_waiter_sw_rt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  359:     start_lock_waiter(sw, rt, Config).
  360: 
  361: lock_waiter_sw_wt(suite) -> [];
  362: lock_waiter_sw_wt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  363:     start_lock_waiter(sw, wt,Config).
  364: 
  365: lock_waiter_wr_r(suite) -> [];
  366: lock_waiter_wr_r(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  367:     start_lock_waiter(wr, r, Config).
  368: 
  369: lock_waiter_srw_r(suite) -> [];
  370: lock_waiter_srw_r(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  371:     start_lock_waiter(srw, r, Config).
  372: 
  373: lock_waiter_sw_sw(suite) -> [];
  374: lock_waiter_sw_sw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  375:     start_lock_waiter(sw, sw,Config).
  376: 
  377: lock_waiter_srw_srw(suite) -> [];
  378: lock_waiter_srw_srw(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  379:     start_lock_waiter(srw, srw,Config).
  380: 
  381: lock_waiter_wr_wr(suite) -> [];
  382: lock_waiter_wr_wr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  383:     start_lock_waiter(wr, wr,Config).
  384: 
  385: lock_waiter_sw_w(suite) -> [];
  386: lock_waiter_sw_w(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  387:     start_lock_waiter(sw, w,Config).
  388: 
  389: lock_waiter_sw_wr(suite) -> [];

  391:     start_lock_waiter(sw, wr,Config).

  488: 
  489: lock_waiter_w_w(suite) -> [];
  490: lock_waiter_w_w(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  491:     start_lock_waiter(w, w, Config).
  492: 
  493: lock_waiter_w_rt(suite) -> [];
  494: lock_waiter_w_rt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     start_lock_waiter(w, rt, Config).
  496: 
  497: lock_waiter_w_wt(suite) -> [];
  498: lock_waiter_w_wt(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  499:     start_lock_waiter(w, wt, Config).
  500: 
  501: start_lock_waiter(BlockOpA, BlockOpB, Config) ->
  502:     [N1, N2] = Nodes = ?acquire_nodes(2, Config),
  503: 
  504:     TabName = mk_tab_name(lock_waiter_),
  505:     ?match({atomic, ok}, mnesia:create_table(TabName,
  506: 					     [{ram_copies, [N1, N2]}])),
  507: 
  508:     %% initialize the table with object {1, c} - when there
  509:     %% is a read transaction, the read will find that  value
  510:     ?match({atomic, ok}, mnesia:sync_transaction(fun() -> mnesia:write({TabName, 1, c}) end)),
  511:     rpc:call(N2, ?MODULE, sync_tid_release, []),
  512: 
  513:     Tester = self(),
  514:     Fun_A =fun() ->
  515: 		   NewCounter = incr_restart_counter(),
  516: 		   if
  517: 		       NewCounter == 1 ->
  518: 			   Tester ! go_ahead_test,
  519: 			   receive go_ahead -> ok end;
  520: 		      true -> ok
  521: 		   end,
  522: 		   lock_waiter_fun(BlockOpA, TabName, a),
  523: 		   NewCounter
  524: 	   end,
  525: 
  526:     %% it's not possible to just spawn the transaction, because
  527:     %% the result shall be evaluated
  528:     A = spawn_link(N1, ?MODULE, perform_restarted_transaction, [Fun_A]),
  529: 
  530:     ?match(ok, receive go_ahead_test -> ok after 10000 -> timeout end),
  531: 
  532:     mnesia_test_lib:sync_trans_tid_serial([N1, N2]),
  533: 
  534:     Fun_B = fun() ->
  535: 		    lock_waiter_fun(BlockOpB, TabName, b),
  536: 		    A ! go_ahead,
  537: 		    wait(infinity)
  538: 	    end,
  539: 
  540:     B = spawn_link(N2, mnesia, transaction, [Fun_B, 100]),
  541: 
  542:     io:format("waiting for A (~p on ~p) to be in the queue ~n", [A, [N1, N2]]),
  543:     wait_for_a(A, [N1, N2]),
  544: 
  545:     io:format("Queues ~p~n",
  546: 	      [[{N,rpc:call(N, mnesia, system_info, [lock_queue])} || N <- Nodes]]),
  547: 
  548:     KillNode = node(B),
  549:     io:format("A was in the queue, time to kill Mnesia on B's node (~p on ~p)~n",
  550: 	      [B, KillNode]),
  551: 
  552:     mnesia_test_lib:kill_mnesia([KillNode]), % kill mnesia of fun B
  553: 
  554:     %% Read Ops does not need to be restarted
  555:     ExpectedCounter =
  556: 	if
  557: 	    BlockOpA == sw, BlockOpB == w -> 1;
  558: 	    BlockOpA == sw, BlockOpB == wt -> 1;
  559: 	    BlockOpA == sw, BlockOpB == wr -> 1;
  560: 	    BlockOpA == srw, BlockOpB == w -> 1;
  561: 	    BlockOpA == srw, BlockOpB == wt -> 1;
  562: 	    BlockOpA == srw, BlockOpB == wr -> 1;
  563: 	    BlockOpA == r,  BlockOpB /= sw -> 1;
  564: 	    BlockOpA == rt, BlockOpB /= sw -> 1;
  565: 	    true -> 2
  566: 	end,
  567:     receive {'EXIT', B, _} -> ok
  568:     after 3000 -> ?error("Timeout~n", []) end,
  569:     receive {'EXIT', A, Exp1} -> ?match({atomic, ExpectedCounter}, Exp1)
  570:     after 3000 -> ?error("Timeout~n", []) end,
  571: 
  572:     %% the expected result depends on the transaction of
  573:     %% fun A - when that doesn't change the object in the
  574:     %% table (e.g. it is a read) then the predefined
  575:     %% value {Tabname, 1, c} is expected to be the result here
  576:     ExpectedResult =
  577: 	case BlockOpA of
  578: 	    w -> {TabName, 1, a};
  579: 	    sw ->{TabName, 1, a};
  580: 	    _all_other -> {TabName, 1, c}
  581: 	end,
  582: 
  583:     ?match({atomic, [ExpectedResult]},
  584: 	   mnesia:transaction(fun() -> mnesia:read({TabName, 1}) end, 100)),
  585:     ?verify_mnesia([N1], [N2]).
  586: 
  587: mk_tab_name(Prefix) ->
  588:     Count = erlang:unique_integer([monotonic,positive]),
  589:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([Prefix , '_', Count])).
  590: 
  591: lock_waiter_fun(Op, TabName, Val) ->
  592:     case Op of
  593: 	rt ->  mnesia:read_lock_table(TabName);
  594: 	wt ->  mnesia:write_lock_table(TabName);
  595: 	r  ->  mnesia:read({TabName, 1});
  596: 	w ->   mnesia:write({TabName, 1, Val});
  597: 	wr ->  mnesia:wread({TabName, 1});
  598: 	srw -> mnesia:read(TabName, 1, sticky_write);
  599: 	sw ->  mnesia:s_write({TabName, 1, Val})
  600:     end.
  601: 
  602: wait_for_a(Pid, Nodes) ->
  603:     wait_for_a(Pid, Nodes, 5).
  604: 
  605: wait_for_a(_P, _N, 0) ->
  606:     ?error("Timeout while waiting for lock on a~n", []);
  607: 
  608: wait_for_a(Pid, Nodes, Count) ->
  609:     %%    io:format("WAIT_FOR_A ~p ON ~w ~n", [Pid, Nodes]),
  610:     List = [rpc:call(N, mnesia, system_info, [lock_queue]) || N <- Nodes],
  611:     Q = lists:append(List),
  612:     check_q(Pid, Q, Nodes, Count).
  613: 
  614: check_q(Pid, [{{_Oid,_Tid}, _Op, Pid, _WFT} | _Tail], _N, _Count) ->
  615:     ok;
  616: check_q(Pid, [{_Oid, _Op, Pid, _Tid, _WFT} | _Tail], _N, _Count) ->
  617:     ok;
  618: check_q(Pid, [_ | Tail], N, Count) ->
  619:     check_q(Pid, Tail, N, Count);
  620: check_q(Pid, [], N, Count) ->
  621:     timer:sleep(500),
  622:     wait_for_a(Pid, N, Count - 1).
  623: 
  624: perform_restarted_transaction (Fun_Trans) ->
  625:     %% the result of the transaction shall be:
  626:     %%  - undefined (if the transaction was never executed)
  627:     %%  - Times ( number of times that the transaction has been executed)
  628: 
  629:     Result = mnesia:transaction(Fun_Trans, 100),
  630:     exit(Result).
  631: 
  632: %% Returns new val
  633: incr_restart_counter() ->
  634:     NewCount =
  635: 	case get(count_restart_of_transaction) of
  636: 	    undefined -> 1;
  637: 	    OldCount -> OldCount + 1
  638: 	end,
  639:     put(count_restart_of_transaction, NewCount),
  640:     NewCount.
  641: 
  642: wait(Mseconds) ->
  643:     receive
  644:     after Mseconds -> ok
  645:     end.
  646: 
  647: 
  648: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  649: 
  650: restart_r_one(suite) -> [];
  651: restart_r_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  652:     start_restart_check(r, one, Config).
  653: 
  654: restart_w_one(suite) -> [];
  655: restart_w_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  656:     start_restart_check(w, one, Config).
  657: 
  658: restart_rt_one(suite) -> [];
  659: restart_rt_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  660:     start_restart_check(rt, one, Config).
  661: 
  662: restart_wt_one(suite) -> [];
  663: restart_wt_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  664:     start_restart_check(wt, one, Config).
  665: 
  666: restart_wr_one(suite) -> [];
  667: restart_wr_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  668:     start_restart_check(wr, one, Config).
  669: 
  670: restart_sw_one(suite) -> [];
  671: restart_sw_one(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  672:     start_restart_check(sw, one, Config).
  673: 
  674: restart_r_two(suite) -> [];
  675: restart_r_two(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  676:     start_restart_check(r, two, Config).
  677: 
  678: restart_w_two(suite) -> [];
  679: restart_w_two(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  680:     start_restart_check(w, two, Config).
  681: 
  682: restart_rt_two(suite) -> [];
  683: restart_rt_two(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  684:     start_restart_check(rt, two, Config).
  685: 
  686: restart_wt_two(suite) -> [];
  687: restart_wt_two(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  688:     start_restart_check(wt, two, Config).
  689: 
  690: restart_wr_two(suite) -> [];
  691: restart_wr_two(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  692:     start_restart_check(wr, two, Config).
  693: 
  694: restart_sw_two(suite) -> [];
  695: restart_sw_two(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  696:     start_restart_check(sw, two, Config).
  697: 
  698: start_restart_check(RestartOp, ReplicaNeed, Config) ->
  699:     [N1, N2, N3] = Nodes = ?acquire_nodes(3, Config),
  700: 
  701:     {TabName, _TabNodes} = create_restart_table(ReplicaNeed, Nodes),
  702: 
  703:     %% initialize the table with object {1, c} - when there
  704:     %% is a read transaction, the read will find that  value
  705:     ?match({atomic, ok}, mnesia:sync_transaction(fun() -> mnesia:write({TabName, 1, c}) end)),
  706: 
  707:     %% Really sync tid_release
  708:     rpc:multicall([N2,N3], ?MODULE, sync_tid_release, []),
  709:     Coord = self(),
  710: 
  711:     Fun_A = fun() ->
  712: 		    NewCounter = incr_restart_counter(),
  713: 		    case NewCounter of
  714: 			1 ->
  715: 			    mnesia:write({TabName, 1, d}),
  716: 			    %% send a message to the test proc
  717: 			    Coord ! {self(),fun_a_is_blocked},
  718: 			    receive go_ahead -> ok end;
  719: 			_ ->
  720: 			    %% the fun will NOT be blocked here
  721: 			    restart_fun_A(RestartOp, TabName)
  722: 		    end,
  723: 		    NewCounter
  724: 	    end,
  725: 
  726:     A = spawn_link(N1, ?MODULE, perform_restarted_transaction, [Fun_A]),
  727:     ?match_receive({A,fun_a_is_blocked}),
  728: 
  729:     %% mnesia shall be killed at that node, where A is reading
  730:     %% the information from
  731:     Read = kill_where_to_read(TabName, N1, [N2, N3]),
  732: 
  733:     %% wait some time to let mnesia go down and spread those news around
  734:     %% fun A shall be able to finish its job before being restarted
  735:     Wait = fun(Loop) ->
  736: 		   wait(300),
  737: 		   sys:get_status(mnesia_monitor),
  738: 		   case lists:member(Read, mnesia_lib:val({current, db_nodes})) of
  739: 		       true -> Loop(Loop);
  740: 		       false -> ok
  741: 		   end
  742: 	   end,
  743:     Wait(Wait),
  744:     A ! go_ahead,
  745: 
  746:     %% the sticky write doesn't work on remote nodes !!!
  747:     ExpectedMsg =
  748: 	case RestartOp of
  749: 	    sw when ReplicaNeed == two ->
  750: 		{'EXIT',A,{aborted,  {not_local, TabName}}};
  751: 	    _all_other ->
  752: 		case ReplicaNeed of
  753: 		    one ->
  754: 			{'EXIT',A,{aborted,  {no_exists, TabName}}};
  755: 		    two ->
  756: 			{'EXIT',A,{atomic, 2}}
  757: 		end
  758: 	end,
  759: 
  760:     ?match_receive(ExpectedMsg),
  761: 
  762:     %% now mnesia has to be started again on the node KillNode
  763:     %% because the next test suite will need it
  764:     ?match([], mnesia_test_lib:start_mnesia(Nodes, [TabName])),
  765: 
  766: 
  767:     %%  the expected result depends on the transaction of
  768:     %%  fun A - when that doesn't change the object in the
  769:     %%  table (e.g. it is a read) then the predefined
  770:     %%  value {Tabname, 1, c} is expected to be the result here
  771: 
  772:     ExpectedResult =
  773: 	case ReplicaNeed of
  774: 	    one ->
  775: 		[];
  776: 	    two ->
  777: 		case RestartOp of
  778: 		    w -> [{TabName, 1, a}];
  779: 		    _ ->[ {TabName, 1, c}]
  780: 		end
  781: 	end,
  782: 
  783:     ?match({atomic, ExpectedResult},
  784: 	   mnesia:transaction(fun() -> mnesia:read({TabName, 1}) end,100)),
  785:     ?verify_mnesia(Nodes, []).
  786: 
  787: create_restart_table(ReplicaNeed, [_N1, N2, N3]) ->
  788:     TabNodes =
  789: 	case ReplicaNeed of
  790: 	    one ->  [N2];
  791: 	    two ->  [N2, N3]
  792: 	end,
  793:     TabName = mk_tab_name(restart_check_),
  794:     ?match({atomic, ok}, mnesia:create_table(TabName, [{ram_copies, TabNodes}])),
  795:     {TabName, TabNodes}.
  796: 
  797: restart_fun_A(Op, TabName) ->
  798:     case Op of
  799: 	rt -> mnesia:read_lock_table(TabName);
  800: 	wt -> mnesia:write_lock_table(TabName);
  801: 	r ->  mnesia:read( {TabName, 1});
  802: 	w ->  mnesia:write({TabName, 1, a});
  803: 	wr -> mnesia:wread({TabName, 1});
  804: 	sw -> mnesia:s_write({TabName, 1, a})
  805:     end.
  806: 
  807: kill_where_to_read(TabName, N1, Nodes) ->
  808:     Read = rpc:call(N1,mnesia,table_info, [TabName, where_to_read]),
  809:     case lists:member(Read, Nodes) of
  810: 	true ->
  811: 	    mnesia_test_lib:kill_mnesia([Read]),
  812: 	    Read;
  813: 	false ->
  814: 	    ?error("Fault while killing Mnesia: ~p~n", [Read]),
  815: 	    mnesia_test_lib:kill_mnesia(Nodes),
  816: 	    Read
  817:     end.
  818: 
  819: sync_tid_release() ->
  820:     sys:get_status(whereis(mnesia_tm)),
  821:     sys:get_status(whereis(mnesia_locker)),
  822:     ok.
  823:
